The Light Burns Dimly.--The light which is given to shine brighter and brighter unto the perfect day, burns dimly. 
                                                                           1157
The church no longer sends out the clear bright rays of light amidst the moral darkness that is enveloping the world as a funeral pall. The light of many does not burn or shine. They are moral icebergs (Letter 1f, 1890).
